review: Jardiance (empagliflozin):Started this in addition to Trulicity with hopes to add to weight loss and lower sugars a bit more. I didn't lose any additional weight but it did seem to lower sugar. However, after taking this for about a year, I started getting a yeast infection. I NEVER get them. I tried everything. Prescription meds, creams, suppositories. Nothing worked to get rid of it. I was blistering, peeling, and bleeding. I also had a pretty constant UTI. I even used moist wipes per the doctor's order from day one to keep extra clean. At first I thought it could be those so I changed brands and even went to the ultra sensitive ones. Then I thought to check here and I'm so glad I did! After realizing it could be Jardiance, I went off of it and the infections stopped on their own with no other intervention! My doc tried to start again with lower dose but as soon as I started getting the first sign of infections coming back, I ditched it. Waiting on an appointment with an endo to see what's next.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I've been on Jardiance in combination with metformin for about 5 months.  The only side effect I had was a couple yeast infections at the very beginning.  My blood sugars are pretty good and my A1c is 6.3 but that was never a problem.  I have also lost 35lbs without changing my diet or any real exercise besides short walks that I always did.  I am really questioning why my previous doctor never put me on any thing besides metformin when I complained about high blood sugars for YEARS!  He said, "Oh, your A1C is fine so it's fine to have blood sugars of 250. "  I think maybe he shouldn't be a doctor.  Anyway.  Jardiance seems to be a good medication for me at least.  I take 25mg once a day in a pill form.  Take care out there fellow diabetics.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Was on Jardiance for 2 months and developed a SEVERE urinary tract infection.  I went into renal failure.  The doctors gave me a 50% chance of survival.  I spent 2 weeks in ICU.  This medication should be removed from the market.  No one should take this medication, besides it didn't lower my blood sugars at all.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I was taking Jardiance when I became infected with flu virus.  I developed body aches at the highest level I've ever experienced in my life!  Next my neck area swelled up and there were giant softball sized lumps on either side of my lower neck area.  I developed a huge rash that looked like a yeast infection all over my groin area. I went to the ER where I was diagnosed with stage 4 ketoacidosis and the doctor told my family I had only 4 hours left to live! In ICU, the doctor put me on insulin and I began to improve and spent an additional 2 weeks in the hospital with pneumonia.  The side effects of Jardiance are so life threatening, I will not ever take this medication again, it's just not worth it and my blood glucose numbers didn't improve enough to justify the risk factors.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Have been  on Jardiance since its introduction about 2015. Started for Type 2 Diabetes then later developed unrelated heart problems with reduced Ejection Fraction. Jardiance was very effective in treating both conditions continually for the last seven years. I am a circumcised male and have had no problems at all with yeast problems that women report. I take the higher 25mg dose which is priced the same as the 12.5mg dosage. I also take Metformin, glipizide, and Ozempic.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):This drug nearly killed me.  Started at 10 mg a year ago, moved to higher dose shortly after beginning.  Was all good for the last year.  3 weeks ago I developed a sore spot beneath my scrotum on a Tuesday, by Friday I was in ER in need of life saving surgery to remove infection from Fournier's gangrene.  They told me if I was not as healthy as I am and waited the weekend to see primary care Dr... I would have died from septic shock.  The ER docs diagnosed in 20 mins, said it not rare and Jardiance was the cause.  Fourniers gangrene has a 20 to 50% mortality rate, not a word about it from primary care.  ER and surgical team says they see at least a case per week.  This drug and the 3 other brands that work similarly are very dangerous.  Diabetes is a money maker, they make more money when we are sick.  Drug companies and doctors have lawyers protecting them......nobody but ER doctors, surgeons and nurses protect the patient once the damage is done.  Get off these drugs.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Male 59 I've been on Jardiance for 1 month and numbers went down 40 pts first day. My numbers are stable 150 and lost 14 lbs. I do get light headed but that's it. Can't say I pee more but love this losing weight. I'm at a weight that I haven't seen in over 30 yrs. Make sure you eat right.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):58 yr old female with high blood pressure and sugars. I’ve been on metformin for a few years to control my blood sugars, which suddenly spiked a couple of months ago with no weight gain. I was 256 lbs. my Dr started me on a very low does of ozempic and then added jardiance. I feel pretty nauseous much of the time, but this is expected to lessen as I’m on them longer. However, strangely, my urination is much less! I drink lots of water, and used to wake at least every 2-2 1/2 hours to urinate at night. Now I am going for up to 5 hours! I have searched the internet but can not find anyone else who has had this experience. Also, my Dr said to use wipes after urinating, which I usually do, and haven’t had any problems so far…I’ve been on ozempic for 2 months and jardiance for 15 days. I’ve dropped about 12 pounds.
Jardiance (empagliflozin):This medication made me so sick I almost went into the hospital. Easy to use. Horrible medication, for me.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Terrible!! This is 3 months on it...  nausea,  stomach pain, extreme tiredness,  urination every 45 mins, muscle weakness horrible that I can't make my bed without resting, shortness of breath, dizziness bouts, liver pain, fatigue and my sugar never has gone down. I feel this stuff is very dangerous.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Jardiance almost caused me to wreck my car. Thankfully I was stopped at the time and had the quick thinking to put my car into park before I passed out from hypoglycemia. It also, on a separate occasion, put me in the ICU due to euglycemic Diabetic Ketoacidosis. So yeah it almost killed me twice and now I have a huge hospital bill to pay. Avoid this horrible medicine at all cost!!!

Jardiance (empagliflozin):On this for a month now and have not had a reading over 135 since I started this. I use the sliding scale process on my Lantus insulin.Very pleased with the results No problems thanks for this me drugpeter

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I am just finishing week 2 at 10mg before going up to 25mg.  I do pee more during the day and have always peed a lot at night. I read the reviews before starting and stocked up on wipes from Amazon 99.9% water that are in every washroom and in my purse.  I was diagnosed with diabetes because of a urine sample for a yeast infection, so was afraid I would get them on this drug.  Nothing so far, but the 1300 wipes that were delivered last week might not last long as I am obsessive about it. No other symptoms.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I was prediabetes since Dec 2017. April 2021 A1c was 7.8 started Jardiance, first 3 month A1c was lowered to 6.6 . Next A1c lowered to 6.3.  I have been exercising 30 minutes a day. Diet no added sugar fruit vegatables . No side effects so far will try to go off med when reach normal A1c

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Strongly recommend against using this drug. Side effects were substantial: UTI (male), frequent urination with copious output, painful genital/rectal area. Symptoms abated ~3 days after discontinuing drug. The drug is very expensive, suggest discussing other treatment with doctor. User beware.

Jardiance is a miracle drug for me. I lost weight on keto/intermittent fasting and maintain a low carb diet but gluconeogenesis was sending my blood sugar up to 350.  Jardiance keeps my blood sugar 120-150. As long as I drink a lot of liquids and rinse after urinating, I have no problem with yeast or itching anymore.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):This was the last SGLT2 that I will ever try.  I have at various times been on Invokana, Invokamet, and Farxiga, and despite my resevations, now Jardiance.  I could only take it for less than a week before deciding this was absolutely not for me.  I had to pee at least once hourly and sometimes 2 or 3 times in an hour. This was extremely disruptive at work and when trying to drive any distance at all.  It seemed that every time I emptied my bladder within an hour or less I would have to go again. This also occurred at night and resulted in extreme day time fatigue. The urgency would be so extreme that I would dribble in my clothes before making it to the bathroom. It seemed that I could not drink enough water.  There was only a very modest lowering noted with my fingersticks blood sugar tests. The end for me was frequent episodes of lightheadedness so extreme that I thought I would faint. This occurred while sitting, standing, walking and driving. This was the last straw, never again. Not for me.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I do not like Jardiance. It’s causing me to be so tired I can barely function. Leg pain back pain.  I just thought it was from my back but after reading some of these remarks I’m beginning to see that it could very easily be the medication. But then I get this urge to go to the bathroom to urinate and when I get there I can’t go. I want to my doctor today and he gave me medicine for a yeast infection. If this is what’s causing me to be so excessively tired and painful I got to get off it because I cannot function like this. I feel like I’ve been hit by a Mack truck. So I’m not gonna take any more staring tomorrow. Thanks for everyone’s input.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Love Jardiance, can’t afford it now that I’m retired!!! Thanks Big Pharma!!!

Jardiance (empagliflozin):This medicine is horrible! Never again will I take it! Itchy lady parts no relief. Countless drs appointments and I feel horrible. Stopped Jardiance 3 weeks ago and lady parts feel horrible. Its between trulicity and this med.

No one and no thing can do it all for you but it is possible to return to healthy life.Jim P.

My sugar was running around 260 with just Trulicity and after Jardiance it's now around 140 in the mornings.  I was 212 pounds and now I'm 195.  I try to drink lots of fluids during the day then taper off towards 7:00 PM so I only get up once a night to urinate.  I have also been walking a mile every evening.  Jardiance has helped me tremendously and can't wait to see what my A1C is in October.
Jardiance (empagliflozin):I lost 15 lbs - Sugar count down for 10 -  to 6.6 - Amazing results -  recommend to all

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I started Jardiance in addition to insulin, Metformin and Olmetec (for hypertension). Initially I had a few middle of the night hypos, which then levelled out. I have had constant yeast infections, one after the other following treatment. I have gained weight, not lost. I have fluid on my knee and joint pain. My urine output decreased, I no longer get up during the night. I am constantly exhausted.However, I would like to continue it due to the benefits for my heart and kidneys; the yeast infections, however are too constant and too severe for that to happen.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I had reduced my A1C from 10.4 to 6.4 in 3 months with increased exercise and a rather severe dietary change (semi-keto, no refined sugar, no pasta, no white bread, no rice, lots of fruit and salads and eggs and meat and cheese). I'd been taking glimepiride but my new GP wanted to get me on something less harmful. Started with Metformin, which I couldn't tolerate for several reasons (mainly "taking giant horse pills that make me feel like rubbish"), so we moved to Jardiance 10mg daily. That was 2 weeks ago. Fasting glucose levels are up a bit but not intolerable, I've lost 5 lbs, but most importantly: zero side effects. Very optimistic about this one.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I’m baffled by the reviews implying this medication is dangerous. I’ve struggled with my a1c for years. After being placed on this medication my blood sugars have been amazingly normal. And I’m not keeping a strict diet. Even with cheat days and the occasional carb heavy meal by the next day my blood sugar is normal. This is without metformin.  I only take Lantus (long acting) and jardiance. I haven’t noticed any real weight loss but if my blood sugar stays like this my next a1c is going to be under 6.5. I’m still waiting for my insurance to authorize its usage but I pray it’s approved. Never has meds been this effective.
Jardiance (empagliflozin):I have been taking this for over a year now and have have no side effects whatsoever. It had lowered my a1c to about 7 . I take it in conjunction with metformin.

I was started on Jardiance 10 mg once daily as my HgbA1c increased to 8.3 for lack of exercise and poor food choices during the pandemic. My last A1c is down to 7.5 and I intend to get it lower to below 7.0 I was skeptical about starting this drug due to some rare serious side effects. So far I'm doing okay with it and I just need to remember to drink lots of fluids for tendency of dehydration especially during hot weather and working out.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):My doctor prescribed Jardiance to go along with my metformin. She said I would lose weight as well and possibly get a yeast infection. I started the medication immediately and before the week was out I had a really bad yeast infection. I haven’t had one in years. The itching was really bad. I was given diflucan. Usually diflucan works the same day but this time it took 3 days to kick in. A few days passed and I now have another yeast infection worst than the first time. Major itching and burning when I urinate. Excessive thirst. I’m calling my physician in the morning because this is too much.

Took Empagliflozin for a year. From the start had a raging inquenchable thirst. Also had constant need to urinate, would be very urgent, occasionally wouldn’t make it in time. Was very waring, seemed to be in the toilet all the time. Also had to get up at least once or twice during night, which disturbed my sleep. After a year couldn’t cope anymore, and came off the drug. Thirst went immediately. However, it’s now 6 months since stopped taking Empagliflozin and feel it’s left me with permanent side effects. Still need to urinate more than did before, used to be able to go out for 5 hours without needing a trip to the toilet, but now can only go about 3 hours. Luckily don’t often have to get up in the night anymore, but  don’t ever get a lie in as by 8 hours I wake with full bladder. Feel as if the Empagliflozin  has left me with a permanently weakened bladder, which has affected my quality of life. Would not recommend Empagliflozin to anyone based on my experiences.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Within three days of using the medication I was all the time extremely thirsty.  I do drink a lot of water, more than a gallon a day. and I got a urinary tract infection too.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):At first I really loved this drug. My glucose levels were better. I have only been taking it a couple of months and got the worst vaginal yeast in my life. (Haven’t had one in 15 years.) My feet hurt all the time and I can’t walk long distances due to severe leg pain. I have never had leg pain like this I am always the energetic one that is ready to go on a hike. This week I wanted to do a hike in Sequoia Nat’l Park but I just couldn’t do it due to the severe leg pain and ROARING yeast infection. I think when I get back home to Texas I need to get on a healthy low carb life style and stick to it along with moderate exercise. This experience while on vacation was a huge wake up call. Today is June 8, 2021. I am scared of Jardiance and the possible long term complications of its use.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):So very disappointed in this experience. Jardiance (empagliflozin):10 mg for 6 months. Made decision to discontinue drug for fear of possible  future problems associated with this.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I have been declared a diabetic for the past 15 years. No lows either.  I am grateful for this medication.
Jardiance (empagliflozin):I started Jardiance and it did lower my A1C but the yeast infection is unbearable.  Had to stop using it.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):Thank you!!  My endocrinologist added Jardiance 25mg to my metformin and insulin pump regiment. I do drink a lot of water anyway so the frequent urination didn't seem out of the norm. Roughly every couple of hours I go and no UTI issues. After one week I lost four pounds; that's a nice benefit! I've also been able to adjust down my insulin rate.  I'm very satisfied so far with this medication.

Jardiance (empagliflozin):I have been taking Jardiance now for nearly one year. Very happy no side effects other than weight loss. So much better than Metformin no more bowel problems.
